entry.sense: 1. naOava Eanohu, aor. _a {yanoOavu}, (inf. n. naOovN, TA,) He became distant, or far removed, from him, or it. (Ḳ.)
naOava, aor. _a {yanoOavu}, inf. n. naOovN He was slow, or tardy. (TA.)
Also, inf. n. naOovN and manoOavN, He walked, or went, syn. saEaI, (Ḳ,) at a slow pace. (TA.)
4. AnOvhu, inf. n. UinoMvN, He removed him, or it, far off; put him, or it, at a distance. (TA.)
sayorN manoOvN [so accord. to a marginal note in the L, in the handwriting of SM] A slow pace, or going, or journeying. (TA.)
niYodulN Calamity; incubus; nightmare: see DiYobulN.
1. naYifa He disliked, disapproved, or hated. (IAạr, art. Anf.)
1. naOaI bihi [He, or it, removed him; put or placed him at a distance, away, or far away.] (Ṣ, art. TrH.)
naOaI He shrank from a thing: see an ex. in a verse cited voce daf-N.
4. OanoMhu: see MnaAhu in art. AnI.
10. AisotanoOaI i. q. AisotanaACa q. v. in art. nwO.
nuWoIN A trench dug round a tent, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) or a barrier [raised] around it, (T, IB, TA,) to prevent the rain-water from entering it, (Ṣ,) or keep off a torrent. (Ḳ.)
4. OanobaDa fI qawosihi He made the string of his bow to vibrate, that it might twang. (Ḳ.)
10. AisotanobaTa He drew forth, elicited, extracted, extorted: see 4 in art. xrj. See also Bḍ, and Jel, iv. 85. It may sometimes be rendered He excogitated.
1. nabaEa It (water) welled, or issued forth.
nabaEa Ealayohimo: see nabaOa Ealayhimo.
4. OanobaEa He (God) made, or caused, water to issue. (Mṣb.)
naboEN The tree so-called: see an ex. of its n. un. in a verse cited voce taHaw-afa and taxaw-afa.
naboEN: see XawoHaTN and XiroyaAnN and fatoHN.
naboEaAni The two shafts of a cart: so called because they were commonly made of wood of the tree called naboE: see raAd-apN.
AnobaEu, irregularly formed from the augmented verb OanobaEa: see an ex. in a couplet cited voce saqaI.
nbq mn AlTryq and AnbAq denote nearness and shortness in a way (TA, art. Ejl), like musotaEojilapN.
nabiqN, properly the fruit of the sidor or lote-tree, is also applied to The tree called sidor itself: see dawomN. The fruit so called is a drupe, resembling the crab.
It seems to be also applied to A drupe absolutely, or a drupe like that of the sidor: see its dim., nubayoqapN↓ voce OaXokalu: see also XiroyaAnN.
nbyq [app. nubayoqN] A bad sort of dates, also called HuboyaqN. (TA in art. Hbq.)
See nabiqN.
nabiyqapN of a grape-vine, A zamaEap when it has grown large. (ISh in TA, art. zmE.)
nabolN Arrows: (M:) or Arabian arrows: (T, Ṣ, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ:) for the sing. they say sahomN. (T.)
nubolN Sharpness, acuteness, or sagacity; syn. cakaMCN: and generosity, or nobility; syn. najaAbapN. (Ḳ.)

nubolN Excellence; (T, M;) syn. najaAbapN; and also cakaMCN. (M.) [Ex.],
kafaI AlmaroCa nubalFA Oano tuEad-a maEaAyibuho . (MF, art. Hbr.)
1. maA nabiha lahu He did not know it; or know, or have knowledge, of it; was not cognizant of it; or did not understand it. (Ḳ.)
nabiha lilOamori His attention became roused to the thing, or affair, after he had forgotten it. (AZ, Ṣ.)
maA nabihotu lahu: see maA Oabihotu lahu.
nabaha Ealayohimo: see nabaOa Ealayhimo.
nabuha He was, or became, eminent, celebrated, or well known. (Ṣ, Ḳ,* TA.)
2. nab-ahahu EalaI AlX-aIoCi He made him acquainted with the thing; informed him of it; gave him notice of it; notified it to him. (Ṣ.)
nab-ahahu liloOamori ‡ [He roused his attention to the thing, or affair]. (TA in art. yqZ.)
nab-ahahu ‡ [He roused him from heedlessness or inadvertence: he roused his attention]. (TA.)
5. tanab-aha EalaI AlX-aIoCi He became acquainted with the thing; became informed of it; had notice of it. (Ṣ.)
tanab-aha liloOamori ‡ [His attention became roused, or he had his attention roused, to the thing, or affair]. (Mṣb and TA in art. yqZ.)
tanab-aha ‡ He became vigilant, wary, or cautious. (Mṣb, TA.)
tanab-aha and Ainotabaha↓ ‡ He became roused from heedlessness or inadvertence; his attention became roused; or he had his attention roused. (TA.)
8. Uinotabaha see 5.
nabiyhN Eminent, celebrated, or well known; (Ṣ, Ḳ,* TA;) contr. of xaAmilN. (Ṣ, TA.)
kalimapu tanobiyhK A word used to give notice, to a person addressed, of something about to be said to him. (TA, voce haA.) See also haA termed tanobiyhN. It may generally be rendered Now.

1. nabaAa Eani AlD-ariybapi It (a sword) recoiled, or reverted, [or glanced off, or away,] from the thing struck with it, without penetrating, or without effect; (TA;) returned from it without cutting; (Mṣb;) took no effect upon it; (Ṣ;) syn. kal-a. (Ḳ.)
nabaAa It (the edge of a sword) would not cut; was blunt. (TA.)
nabaAa Eani AlX-aIoCi It (the sight) recoiled, or reverted, from the thing; was repelled by it; (Ṣ,* Ḳ,* TA;) syn. tajaAfaI (TA) and kl-. (Ḳ.)
nabaA Eani AlX-aIoCi It (nature) recoiled, flinched, shrank, or was averse, from the thing, or shunned it, and would not accept it. (Mṣb.)
nabaA janobuhu Eani AlfiraAXi ‡ His side did not rest, or was restless, or uneasy, upon the bed: (Ḳ, TA:) it shrank from it.
nabaA It (a saddle) was unfirm, or unsteady; not firm, or steady, in its place. (TA.)
nabiI-N: see a verse voce ratomN.
nabiy-apN A thing like the suforap, q. v., made of palm-leaves, upon which flour or meal is sifted. (I'Abbád, O, Ḳ.)
nutuwEN The gums of trees; correctly nutuwHN.
natonFA lahu and waA natonaAhu Fye or shame on him or it! See dafozN.
minotinN, originally munotinN or minotiynN: see manojizN.
1. navalN He cleansed an intestine: see muboEarN.
navuwlN A lean, or emaciated, woman. (IAạr, TA, art. jml.)
naviylN The dust, or earth, of the foundations of a house. (TA, art. vwb.)
naviylapu biYorK The earth that is around a well, that is seen from afar. (Ṣ, art. jbw.)
1. navuwt Eanohu xabarFA and navayot: see rvI.
6. tanaAvayonaAhu: see rvI
OanovaI: see OavonaI.

1. najaEa fiyhi It (a discourse, Ṣ, Ḳ: and exhortation, Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ; and medicine, Ṣ, Mṣb; and fodder, Mṣb) entered into him, and produced an effect upon him: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) or showed its effect [upon him]. (Mṣb.)
It (medicine) benefited him; as also OanojaEa↓ and naj-aEa↓. (TA.) [And It (eating) had an agreeable, a wholesome, or a beneficial, effect upon him: so I have rendered it voce EanaI.]
naj-aEa said of food and of beverage, inf. n. nujuwEN, It was [wholesome, or] suitable, or it agreed. (So accord. to an expl. of the inf. n. in the KL.)
2: see 1.
4: see 1.

8. AinotajaEa He sought after herbage (Ṣ, Mgh, Ḳ) in its place: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) or went to seek after herbage in its place. (Mṣb.) And AntjE baladFA [He sought after herbage in a district, or country]. (Ḳ in art. Hnk.)
nujoEapN The seeking after herbage (Ṣ, Mgh, Ḳ) in its place; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) the going to seek after herbage in its place. (Mṣb.)
najiyEN Effused blood: see 2 in art. xwD.
manojaEN, pl. manaAjiEu A desert: see baAdiyapN.
munotajaEN A place where herbage is sought: see maHoDarN.
nijaAfN of a door, i. q. darowanod [a Persian word, A bolt, or bar.] (IAạr in L, art. rtj.)
TaEonapN najolaMCu A wide wound with a spear or the like. (TA.) See an ex. in a verse cited voce rub-a.
EayonN najolaMCu A wide eye; pl. EuyuwnN nujolN. (TA.) See a verse in art. frg (conj. 4).

minojalN A reaping-hook. (Mgh; and Ṣ, Ḳ, voce miHoSadN.) It has a toothed, or serrated, edge: (A, art. Hz; and Ḳ, art. AXr:) and is sometimes plain. (Ḳ, voce miHaX-N, and M and L, voce sin-N.) See mixolabN and darahorahapN.

[A reaping-hook: or a pruning-hook: sometimes signifying the latter:] an iron implement, having teeth, with which seed-produce is cut: or one with which the wood, or branch, is cut off from the tree, and cast down, or away. (TA.)
najylN: see TaHomaMCu.
4. Oanojama It (rain,, &c.) left off. (Ḳ.)
najomN [A star.]
[Also, An asterism, or constellation: being applied autonomastically to] the Pleiades. (Ṣ.)

nujuwmN [like EiroqN] signifies also The sprouts from the roots [of a tree, or shrub], before the rabiyE [meaning either spring or autumn], the heads of which one sees like large needles, clearing the ground. (TA.) See EusoluwjN.
najomN also signifies ‡ The time when a payment falls due. (Mṣb.) [Hence, app., an ex. cited voce TI-N.]
And hence, (Mṣb,) ‡ An instalment: syn. waZiyfapN. (Mgh, Mṣb.) See also EazolN.
najomN and najomapN A kind of plant, triticum repens or dogs' grass: see viylN.
minojamN The beam of a balance; (MA;) the transverse piece of iron, in which is the tongue, of a balance. (Ṣ, Ḳ.) See Eamuwdu AlmiyzaAni.
1. najaA Alvum dejecit; (Mṣb, TA;) ventumve per anum emisit: (TA:) he voided his ordure; or broke wind.
najaA, inf. n. najaMCN, He was quick, or swift, and outstripped. (Ṣ.) See an ex. of the inf. n., voce gwlN.
najaA He became safe, or secure; he escaped. (Mṣb, &c.)
2. naj-awa see 4.
4. OanojaAhu and naj-aAhu↓ He saved, him; rescued him; preserved him. (Ḳ.)

hom.sense: 10. AisotanojaI He washed, or wiped with a stone or a piece of dry clay, the place [of exit] of his excrement. (Mṣb.)
AisotanojawoA: see 8 in art. sEr.

entry.sense: najowN and najaMCN A shower of rain.
See XuwobuwbN and 1.
njAC A well of which the water is distant [from the mouth]. (O, TA, voce qarabN.)
najowapN An elevated piece of land. (Mṣb.)
najiI-N: see najowaI.
EuroyaAnu Aln-ajiI-i: see art. ErI.
najowaI Secret discourse between two persons or parties. (TA.)
A secret between two persons or parties; as also najiI-N↓. (Ḳ, TA.)
A person, or persons, discoursing secretly, or telling secrets one with another. (TA.)
manojaApN [A cause, or means, of safety: of the measure mafoEalapN, originally manojawapN; similar to mafolaHapN, &c.]. (Ṣ.)
najayotu a dial. var. of najawotu: see dawokapN.
1. naHaza: see an ex. in a verse cited voce EaAsijN.
naAHizN: see naAkitN.
minoHaAzN A mortar; syn. haAwuwnN. (Ḳ.)
5. tanaH-asa see 10..
10. AisotanoHasotuhu Eano kacaA and tanaH-asotuhu↓: see 10 in art. snH.
naHiyfN Slender, slim, thin, spare, lean, or light of flesh.
1. naHala jisomuhu His body became lean, or emaciated. (Ṣ.)
niHolapN i. q. fariyDapN; or diyaAnapN; and diynN, as in the saying maA niHolatuka [What is thy religion?]. (TA.)
1. naHama, said of a horse, seems to be best rendered He breathed pantingly, or hard, with a sound from the chest. See 1 in art. DbH.
naHiymN signifies A sound (Sawot) from the chest of the horse. (TA.)
1. naHaA naHowahu He went towards, or in the direction of, him or it. (Mṣb, TA.)
Also, He pursued his (another's) course, doing as he did; or purposed his purpose.
naHaAhu, inf. n. naHowN, signifies [also] He purposed it, or intended it. (MA.)
naHawotu jiloda AlbaEiyri, and OanoHayatuhu↓, I stripped off the skin of the camel. (Mṣb, voce salaxa). See 4.
2. naH-aI He put a thing aside, or away, or apart; (Mṣb;) removed it from its place, (Mṣb, Ḳ, TA,) placed it at a distance. (TA.)
He made a person to turn away, or withdraw, or retire, from (Eano) an affair.
naH-aI Eanohu AlX-aIoCa He put aside, or away, or he warded off, or removed, from him the thing. See 4.
4. OanoHaI Ealayohi [He leant, bore, or pressed, upon him, or it, with his body, hand, &c.:] i. q. AiEotamada; as also naHaA↓. (IAạr, TA.)

OanoHaI EalaI fulaAnK biAls-awoTi [He attacked such a one with the whip], and biAls-ayofi [with the sword]: and hence biAlt-aEoniyfi ‡ he accosted him with harsh, or rough, behaviour; syn. Oaqobala Ealayohi. (Ḥar, p. 508.)
OanoHaI EalaI AlX-aIoCi bijamiyEi kaf-ihi [He seized the thing with his whole hand]. (M, voce qabaDa [q. v.]).

OanoHayotu EalaI Haloqihi Als-ik-iyna I applied the knife to, or put it across, his throat, or fauces; syn. EaraDotuhu: and in like manner you say, nHI Elyh bXfrth [but whether by this be meant naH-aI or naHaA is doubtful]. (TA.)
See 1.
5. tanaH-aI He, or it, removed; withdrew; went, or moved, away, or aside; (Mṣb;) or retired to a distance. (TA.)
tanaH-aI (TA, art. qEr,) signifies tkl-f An ytkl-m klAmFA naHowiy-FA, i. e. tkl-f Altkl-m ElI Tryq AlnHAp. (IbrD.)

8. AinotaHaI It fell, like a man's hand when he strikes with it upon his other hand; (L, TA, in art. trH:) and, in prostration, he fell with his forehead to the ground, and rested upon his forehead, not upon the palms of his hands: mentioned by Sh, from ʼAbd-Es-Samad Ibn-Hassán, on the authority of some of the Arabs: so says Az. (L and TA in that art.)
naHowN The like of a thing: syn. mivolN. (TA.)
Quantity,, &c.; syn. miqodaArN. (TA.)
A division,, &c.; syn. qisomN. (TA.)
naHowahu: see naHaA.
Earafotuhu fiI naHowi kalaAmihi and fI laHoni klAmh and fI miEoraADi klAmh signify the same. (Mṣb in art. ErD.) See the last of these, voce EaruwDN.
Ait-aYido EalaI naHowika, i. e. Oaw-ino EalaI qadorika [or miqodaArika]: see art. Awn.
naHoIN: see niHoI.
niHoIN A skin for holding liquids: (Ḳ:) or for clarified butter: (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ:) as also naHoIN↓, (Ḳ.)
Xadiydu Aln-aAHiyapi † A hardy man. (TA, art. ErD.)
caAtu Aln-iHoyayoni. Respecting what is said of the woman thus named, and of xaw-aAt, in the Ṣ, see Xrd.
mutanaj-K Going, or being, away from (Eano) a place, person, or thing.
mutanaH-FI [A place to which to turn away, or back, from a thing; or to which one removes, withdraws, or retires afar off]. (Ḳ, voce manokaSN.) See manokaSN and maHorifN.
naAHiyapN i. q. jaAnibN q. v., A side; a lateral, or an outward, or adjacent, part or portion. (Ḳ, &c.)
An apartment of a house. (Mgh, voce Hay-izN.) And the pl., nawaAHK, The outer parts or regions of an animal. The sing. may often be rendered A part, or portion, of a place.

naAHiyapN is of the measure faAEilapN in the sense of the measure mafoEuwlapN, [meaning manoHuw-apN, a part, or the like, or a point, towards which one goes, or directs himself; a point of direction;] because one goes, or directs himself, towards it: (Mṣb:) best rendered as above; adding, or part, region, district, quarter, or tract, considered with respect to its collocation or juxtaposition or direction, or considered as belonging to a whole: a vicinage, or neighbourhood: and a part of a country, a region, district, quarter, or tract, absolutely; a district; a province: often best rendered a side; or a region, district, quarter, or tract: or a part of a place, an apartment: see Hay-izN, in art. Hwz.

Also A limit, bound, or boundary: see two tropical exs. of its pl. (nawaAHK) voce HinowN, and another in a verse voce rasuwlN: or a remote side; syn. jaAnibN mutanaH-K: (Ḳz, in TA:) a tract of land. (KL.) See OufuqN and jaAnibN.

EalaI naAHiyapK Beside, aside, or apart; like ElI jaAnibK and EalI TarafK; and so naAHiyapF and fiI naAHiyapK, &c.: you say jalasa fiI naAHiyapK minohumo He sat aside, or apart, from them: and OanaA fiI nawaAHK mino hecaA AlOamori, expl. voce XafaqN. And fiI naAHiyapi kacaA In the direction of such a thing: see OaXoraI.
huwa EalaI naAHiyatihi He is keeping to his own side, following his own course: see jadiy-apN.

nuxaAEN The spinal cord, or spinal marrow; (Ṣ, Ḳ, &c.;) what extends from the haAmap through (fiI) the vertebræ to the end of the canab, like a cord of marrow. (Zj in his “Khalk el-Insán.”) See also XaliylN and AlbixaAEu.
OanoxaEN: see OaxonaEu.
nixaAfN A boot: (IAạr, Ḳ, TA:) or a boot much patched. (Az, TA.)
1. naxVla see 8.
5. tanax-ala see 8.

8. Ainonaxalahu He cleared it [or sifted it]; as also naxalahu↓ and tanax-alahu↓: (Ḳ [see safosafahu]:) or he took the best of it (Ṣ, Mṣb) to the utmost: (Ṣ:) or he chose the best of it for himself. (TA.)
naxoliI-N A cultivator of palm-trees: see EaTalN.
1. nuxiIa bikacaA He boasted of such a thing: see zuhiIa bikacaA.
naxowapN Pride; self-magnification; haughtiness. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
5. tanad-asa Eani AlOaHobaAri He sought to learn the news privily: see taHad-asa and taHas-asa.
rimaAHN nawaAdisu Piercing spurs: see a verse of El-Kumeyt cited voce gaArapN, in art. gwr.

1. nadafa [He separated and loosened cotton by means of a bow and a kind of wooden mallet, by striking the string of the bow with the mallet: see Halaja; and Harana] he beat cotton with the minodaf↓, (Ṣ, Mṣb,* Ḳ,) also called minodafap↓, i. e., his wooden implement with which he strikes the bowstring, that it [the cotton] might become fine. (Ḳ.)
minodafN and minodafapN: see 1; and see miHoranN and minobaDN.
5. tanad-ala He bound a dasotaAr [or minodiyl i. e. napkin or the like] upon his head. (KL.) And tamanodala↓ biminodiylK He bound a mndyl upon his head. (Mgh.)
Q. Q. 2. tamanodala biraAYiTapK He used a rAYTp [or ryoTap] as a minodiyl. (TA in art. ryT from a trad.)
See 5.
minodalN app., Hard steel (cakarN SulobN, not penis rigens). (Ḳ.) See cakarN.
1. nadima EalaI maA faEala He grieved for what he had done; regretted it; repented of it: or he disliked it. (Mṣb.)
nadiymN A companion in drinking; a cup-companion. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.) And hence, Any convivial companion; a boon-companion.
manodamN Repentance: an inf. n. of nadima; see an ex. in a verse of El-Kattál El-Kilábee, cited voce OaI-N.
1. nadiIa It was, or became, moist, or moistened. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)

maA nadiyaniI minohu XaIoCN, (M,) or maA nadiyaniI minohu XaIoCN Oakorahuhu, (T,) [A thing, or a thing that I dislike,] did not betide me or befall me [from him]. (T, M.) And laA yanodaAka min-iI XaIoCN takorahuhu [A thing that thou dislikest] shall not befall thee [from me]. (M.) maA nadiyato kaf-iI lahu biXar-K [My hand did not evil to him]: and maA nadiytu biXaIoCK takorahuhu [I did not a thing that thou dislikest]. (T.) See also art. Erq, first par., last sentence but two.
saOalotuhu falamo yanoda liI biXaIoCK [I asked him, and he did not to me, or for me, anything]. (TA, in art Enw.)
maA tanodaI SafaAtuhu i. q. maA yabiD-u Hajaruhu, q. v. (Ṣ, art. bD.) See also art. Sfw.
2. nad-aIa see 5.
3. naAdaI Ealayohi [He made proclamation of him] (Ṣ, A, Mṣb) biQloUifolaAsi (A) or Oan-ahu Oafolas (Ṣ) or biOan-ahu SaAra mufolisFA (Mṣb) [that he had become bankrupt, or insolvent].
[naAdaI bh He proclaimed it; made proclamation of it: a very common signification, but one which I have not found in any Lex.]
You say also naAdiI fiI Aln-aAsi, meaning taOac-ana and tqad-ama and OaEolama. (Ṣ in art. Acn. [See Mcanahu].)
wanuwduwA Oano tilokumu Aljan-apu: (Ḳur vii. 41:) see Oano as a contraction of Oan-a.
naAdaAhu turaAbuhu: see nbOth AlArD.
naAdaAhu He called him; called to him; summoned him, or hailed him: (Ṣ, Mṣb:) or, (T, M,) and nAdI bihi, (M,) he called out to him (T, M) with the loudest voice. (T.)
5. tanad-aI [quasi pass. of nad-aI↓, It was moistened, by dew, or the like: or] i. q. nadiIa [it was, or became, moist]: said of a place [&c.]: and i. q. naraw-aI. (TA.)
nidaMCN signifies simply The raising the voice; not implying the expression of meaning by speech. (Er-Rághib, TA.)
Harofu nidaMCi A particle of calling, or hailing, or invocation; as yaA.
The vocative form of speech.

Also, agreeably with many other instances, like xaloqN in the sense of maxoluwqN, an inf. n. used in the sense of a pass. part. n., meaning A person or thing called; the object of a vocative particle, syn. with munaAdFI↓.
nadFI, originally, Rain: (Mṣb:) [but generally it seems to signify dew, absolutely; or day-dew.] See a tropical usage in a verse of El-Kumeyt cited voce riqobapN.
nadFI Bounty; liberality: (Ṣ, M:) a gift. (T.)
nadFI Moisture (Ṣ, Ḳ) of the earth; as also nadaAwapN↓. (Ṣ.)
nadFI is generally thus written: not nadFA.
nadiI-N An assembly: see a verse cited voce XarafN.
nadaAwapN and nuduw-apN Moisture. (Mṣb.) See nadFI.
munaAdFI: see nidaACN.
daAb-apN narojisiy-apN A beast of carriage whose whiteness inclines to yellowness [like the narcissus]. (TA, art. qrTs.)
nirosiyaAnapN A species of dates. (Ṣ, in art. rsw.)

hom.sense: 1. nazaEa UilaI Oaholihi, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) aor. _i {yanoziEu}, (Ṣ,) inf. n. nizaAEN (Ṣ, Ḳ) and nuzuwEN and nazaAEpN; (Ḳ:) and naAzaEa↓; (Ḳ;) He yearned towards or for, longed for, or desired, his family. (Ṣ,* Ḳ,* TA, PṢ).
nazaEotu Uilayohi inf. n. nizaAEN, I yearned towards, longed for, or desired, him or it; syn. xananotu. (Ḥam, p. 429.) See an ex. voce xafoDN.
Hence. nazaEa biI Uilayohi It (desire) invited me to it. (Ḥar, p. 606.)
nazaEa Uilayohi He inclined to it. (Ḥar, p. 234.)

nazaEa UilaI EiroqK kariymK [He inclined to a noble radical, or ancestral, or hereditary quality: and in like manner, laYiymK]: and nazaEa UilaI OaEoraAqihi and nazaEahaA [he inclined to his radical, or ancestral, or hereditary, qualities]: and tazaEato bihi OaEoraAquhu [his radical, or ancestral, or hereditary, qualities inclined him]. (L, in TA.)
nazaE It inclined by likeness. (Mṣb.)

nazaEa UilaI Oabiyhi (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ,) fI AlX-abaha (Ṣ,) and nazaEa OayaAhu, (Ḳ,) He resembled his father: (Mṣb, Ḳ:) or inclined to his father in likeness; syn. cahaba (Ṣ:) or he took after his father; had a natural likeness to him.
nuzuwEN signifies Yearning; and natural inclining.
nazaEa and AinotazaEa↓ He pulled, plucked, or drew, out, or up, or off; removed from his or its place; displaced. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
nazaEa vawobahu, (Mgh, in art. xlE,) and naEolahu, (Mgh and Mṣb in that art.,) He pulled off his garment, and his sandal. See, however, xalaEa.

nazaEa (Mṣb, TA,) aor. _i {yanoziEu}, (TA,) inf. n. nazoEN (Mṣb, TA,) He was at the point [or in the agony] of death; meaning, of having his soul drawn forth: (Mṣb:) he gave up his spirit; as also naAzaEa↓, inf. n. nizaAEN. (TA.)
nazaEa fiI Alquwosi He drew the bow; (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ;) i. e., its string; or he drew, or pulled, the string of the bow with the arrow. (TA.)
tanoziEuhu XaEarapN bayoDaMCu, relating to a horse: see OasofaI.

entry.sense: 3. naAzaEahu AlHabola He contended with him in pulling the rope; syn. jaAcabahu Uiy-aAhu. Hence, nAzEh fI kacaA ‡ He contended, disputed, or litigated, with him, respecting such a thing. (Mgh.)
naAzaEahu AlkalaAma ‡ He disputed with him in, or respecting, words. (TA.)
naAzaEatoniI nafosiI UilaI hawAhaA, inf. n. nizaAEN, My soul strove with me to incline me to love her. (TA.) See 1.
6. tanaAzaEonaA AlHadiyva We discoursed together; one with another. (TA, art. hSr.)
tanaAzaEuwA Al-ajaza bayonahumo (Ḳ, art. rjz,) They recited verses, or poetry, of the metre termed rajaz one with another; as also taEaATawohu. (TḲ, art. rjz.)
tanaAzaEN The contending in altercation, disputing, or litigating, one with another: (Ḳ:) or tanaAzaEuwA they disagreed, one with another; held different ways or opinions. (Mṣb.)
8. UinotazaEa See 1.
AinotazaEa minohu Haq-ahu He wrested from him his right, or due.
AinotazaEa Hadiyvahu: see AiqtDb.
nazaEN Baldness on each side of the forehead: see jalaHN; and gamamN.
nazoEapN A baldness in the side of the forehead. See SadomapN.
biYorN nazuwEN [A deep well] i. q. jarowrN. (A, voce jarowrN.)
nuz-aEN is pl. of naAziEN; as is also nuzuEN. (TA.) See an ex. in a verse cited bAbN.
naz-aAEN Dragging much, or forcibly: see Ḳur, lxx. 16.

AlEroqu naz-aAEN (see Freytag's Arab. Prov., ii. 168) is probably similar to AlEiroqu ds-aAsN, and means The radical, or ancestral, or hereditary, quality is wont to return to its usual possessor: or it may mean, is wont to draw.
OanozaEu: see OajolaHu.
manozaEu biYorK [The bottom of a well; the place from which the water is drawn]. (TA, art. mtH.)
1. nazafa He entirely exhausted (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ) a well, (Mṣb,) or the water of a well. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
manozuwfN Exhausted: see an ex. voce DaraTa.

nazaqN Lightness, and unsteadiness, or lightwittedness, (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ,) on an occasion of anger; (Ḳ;) i. q. sarobaxapN; lightness in any work, or action: hastiness, with foolishness or ignorance: (JK, TA:) hastiness, or sharpness, of temper; irascibility; passionateness: a meaning deduced from various examples, and confirmed by present usage.
naziqN Light, and unsteady, or lightwitted. (Mṣb.) See also nazaqN: and see XuHocuwcN.
naziqapN and nizaAqN↓ A refractory she-camel; hard to be managed. (Mṣb.)
nizaAqN: see naziqapN.
All-abuWapu Oanozaqu mina AlOasadi [The lioness is more impetuous than the lion]. (Ṣ, voce sabuEapN.)

nizokN The penis (cakar, Ṣ, Ḳ, i. e. qaDiyb, TA) of the Dab- (Ṣ, Ḳ) and of the waral: (Ḳ: [in the CK, wAlwarku is erroneously put for wAlwarali:]) accord. to the assertion of the Arabs, (Ṣ,) it (Ṣ, Ḳ,) the former, (Ṣ,) as also the Hirocawon, (Mṣb voce Hrcwn,) has two penes (nizokaAni); (Ṣ, Ḳ, TA;) and the female has quronataAni, i. e. [two wombs] raHimaAni. (TA.)

1. nazala biAlmakaAni (Kull) and nazala AlmakaAna (Mṣb in art. Hl, &c.) He alighted, descended and stopped or sojourned or abode or lodged or settled, in the place; syn. Hal-a fiyhi. (Kull.) See Hal-a.
nazala labanu AlX-aApi [The milk of the ewe descended into her udder; i. e. she secreted milk]. (Ṣ, Ḳ, voce OaDoraEato.)

nazala manozila kacaA It took, or occupied, the place, or became in the position or condition, of such a thing: see a verse cited voce Oano, near the end of the paragraph; and another voce HabiybN; and see manozilapN.
nazalotu, AlwadiIa, for fiI AlwaAdiI: see daxalotu Albayata in art. dxl.
3. naAzalahu He alighted with him, each to oppose the other, in war, or battle; inf. n. munaAzalapN and nizaAlN. (Mṣb.)
4. Oanozalato Her (a camel's) milk descended [into her udder]: opposed to OaqolaSato. (TA, art. qlS.)
Oanozalati All-abana [i. e. All-ibaOa] She (a camel) excerned the first milk, or biestings, into her udder; i. q. Oabosaqato. (TA in art. bzq.)
She excerned milk [either into, or from, the udder].
Oanozalati AlnAqpu All-abana mina AlD-aroEi [or fiI AlDrE] The she-camel excerned the milk from [or into] the udder. (TA, art. crO.)

Oanozalahu He lodged him; made him his guest; or gave him refuge or asylum; syn. MwaAhu; (Ṣ and Ḳ in art. AwI;) and OaDaAfahu and Day-afahu: (Mgh in art. Dyf:) [and he lodged and entertained him;] namely, a guest. (Mṣb.) I. q. OavowaAhu manozilFA. (Fr in T in art. bwO.)
Oanozalahu Eano kacaA He made him to resign, or relinquish, such a thing.
Oanozalotu bika HaAjatiI [app. I imposed my want upon thee]. (Ṣ in art. Er.) And Oanozala HaAjatahu ElI krym. (TA.)
6. tanaAzala He descended gradually, by little and little.

sense.hi: He humbled himself, condescended, to one.

entry.sense: tanaAzaluwA They alighted and ate by turns with different people; i. q. tanaAwabuwA, q. v.
10. Aisotanozalahu He made him, or caused him, or it, to descend. (Mṣb.)
Aisotanozalahu Eano raOayihi [He sought to make him resign, or relinquish, his opinion]. (Bḍ, xii. 11.)
nuzolN Food or rations at a halt: see sukonN, in two places.
nuzulN Food prepared for the guest. (Mṣb. See mafav-apN.)
OaroDN nazilapN: see HaXaAdN.
naziylN A guest. (Ṣ, Mgh, Mṣb,* Ḳ.) See also Ḥar, 353.
naAzilN [Alighting,, &c.,] has for pl. nuzuwlN and nuz-aAlN. (TA.)
naAzilapN A defluxion: pl. nawAzilu. See sil-N.
naAzilapN A severe calamity or affliction, (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ,) that befalls men. (Ṣ, Mṣb.)

manozilN A place of alighting or descending and stopping or sojourning or abiding or lodging or settling: (Mgh:) a place of settlement: an abode; a dwelling; a place where travellers alight in the desert; syn. manohalN: a [house, or mansion, such as is called] daArN: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) or, accord. to the fuqahaMC, less than a dAr, and more than a bayot [or chamber], consisting of at least two chambers (bayotaAni) or three. (Mgh.) See also bayotN.
manozilapN A space which one traverses in journeying. (TA, art. syr.)
manozilapN, used unrestrictedly, Station, standing, footing, or grade; honourable station or rank; a place of preferment.

sense.hi: A predicament in which one stands.

entry.sense: kalimapN bimanozilapi kalimapK OuxoraI A word equivalent, or similar, to another word.

[You say] yusotaEomalu bimanozilapi kacaA It (a word) is used in the manner of such [another word]; generally with respect to government, not necessarily with respect to meaning. (The lexicons passim.)

sense.foreign: Aln-aAzilu mina Ald-iyni wAld-unoyaA manozilapa Aln-uwri mina AlEayoni
sense.hi: Who is, in respect to religion and the world, as light to the eye.

entry.sense: maroEFI munozilN: see musokinN.
2. naz-aha Qll-eh He declared God to be far removed, or free, from every impurity or imperfection, or from everything derogatory from his glory; like sab-aHahu and qad-asahu.

tanoziyhu Qll-ehi is The declaring God to be far removed, or free, [from every imperfection or impurity, or from everything derogatory from his glory; i. e.,] from evil [of every kind]; or from the having anything like unto Him by participation of his essence or otherwise, and from defects that may not be imputed to Him. (TA.)
5. tanaz-aha Eani AlOaqocaAri He shunned, avoided, or kept or removed himself far from, unclean things; (Ṣ,* Mgh, Mṣb;) preserved himself therefrom. (Mgh.)
tanaz-aha, used absolutely, and said of a man, means He shunned, avoided, or kept or removed himself far from, unclean things; kept aloof from,, &c.; or from things occasioning blame. (TA.)
tanaz-aha is best rendered, when not used absolutely, He removed himself, or kept, far, or aloof: and with Eano following it, it may be rendered he shunned, or avoided.
tanaz-aha Eani Albawoli [He purified, or cleansed, himself from urine: a meaning assigned in the TA, art. nzh, by an evident mistranscription, to Astnzh]. (Mṣb in art. brO: and a trad.)
Also, He diverted, or recreated, himself; or took an airing; in the country, or in a garden.
tanaz-aha meaning He went forth to the gardens (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ) and [green fields, or] green plants, and meadows, (Ḳ,) is a mistake, (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ,) accord. to some; but IḲt holds it to be not so. (Mṣb)
[nazihu Alxuluqi in copies of the Ḳ Alxaloqi] and nazohuhu↓ and naAzihuhu↓ [and naziyhuhu↓ and nazihu Aln-afosi (see ZalifN)] Who abstains from that which is indecorous,, &c. (Ḳ, TA.)
nazohN see nazihu Alxuluqi.
naAzihN see nazihu Alxuluqi.
naziyhN: see nazihu Alxuluqi.
naziyhN A pious man; or one who abstains from unlawful things. (TA.)
1. nazaA EalaI AlOunovaI He (a solid-hoofed, or cloven hoofed, animal, and a wild beast,) leaped the female; (Ṣ, &c.;) and so nazaA alone, elliptically.
nazato Hanojazatuhu, said of a camel: see Eazafa.
1. nas-a, aor. yunus-u, He went at a gentle pace. (TA, art. xbz.)
R. Q. 1. nasonasati Alr-iyHu The wind blew coldly: see R. Q. 1 in art. sn.
riyHN nasonaAsapN A cold wind: see sanosaAnapN.
nasiyjahN, applied to a wind: see nay-iHap, in art. nwH.
nisoEN A plaited thong, serving for the noserein of a camel,, &c., and sometimes woven wide, [for a fore-girth,] placed on the breast of a camel. (KL, TA.) See also nisoEapN.

nisoEapN A kind of broad plaited fore-girth for a camel: pl. nisoEN and nisaEN and OanosaAEN: (Ṣ:) or nisaEN and nusoEN and nusuwEN and OanosaAEN are pls. of nisoEN, [a coll. gen. n.,] of which nisoEapN is the n. un. (Ḳ.) See EaZomu Alr-aHoli, in art. EZm.
OanosaAEu AlT-ariyqi † The furrows of the road, made by the beasts with their legs [or feet] in its surface. (TA, voce XarakN.)
minosagapN An instrument for pricking bread: see miroqmN.

1. nasafatohu Alr-iyHu, (Mgh, Mṣb, TA,) aor. _i {yanosifu}, (TA,) inf. n. nasofN; (Mṣb, TA;) and Ainotasafatohu↓, (TA,) The wind carried it away; (TA;) i. q. caratohu [q. v.]; (Mgh;) namely, dust. (Mgh, Mṣb.)
8. Uinotasafa see 1.
minosafN A vessel (wiEaMC) in which dates [and grain] are shaken to remove the dust, &c. (TA in art. nfD.)
1. nasaka He worshipped: used transitively. See an ex. in a verse of El-Aạshà, in the Ṣ, art. nSb. See 5.
4. Oanosaka [app. He washed and purified a garment]. (TA voce UijotaAba.)
5. tanas-aka He devoted himself to religious exercises; applied himself to devotion; (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ:) as also nasaka↓ (Ṣ, Ḳ) and nasuka↓: (Ḳ:) or the last, he became a naAsik. (Ṣ.)
nasiykapN: see EaqiyqapN.
manaAsiku AlHaj-i The religious rites and ceremonies of the pilgrimage: or the places where those rites and ceremonies are performed. (Mṣb.)
8. Ainotasala said of camels' fur: see EaSiymN.
nasolFA waOasolFA is a form of imprecation against a man, like taEosFA wanakosFA. (M, in art. Asl.)
nasolN Progeny, whether of man or beast. (The Lexicons passim.)
5. tanas-ama XayoOF He sought, or endeavoured to get. or attain, a thing, with labour and perseverance: i. q. taTal-abahu. (IbrD.)
tanas-ama Alxayara He sought, searched, or inquired, for, or after, the news. or tidings; (MA, KL;) [as though endeavouring to scent it;] so that he elicited it. (TA.)
nsm mn AlTryq, denoting nearness and shortness of the way. see nbq and musotaEojilapN.
nasamN: see nasiymN.
nasamapN A soul; syn. nafosN, with sukoon: and nasamN souls; syn. nufuwsN. (Mṣb.)
A man. (Ḳ.)

sense.hi: A gentle wind; a gentle gale: a breeze.

entry.sense: The commencement of any wind before it becomes strong: (AḤn, M:) or a pleasant wind: (Ṣ:) or the breath of the wind: (Mṣb:) or the breath of the wind when weak; as also nasamN↓: or a wind from which comes a weak breath: pl. of both OanosaAmN. (M.)
baAridu Aln-asiymi ‡ One who chills people: see vaqiylN.
nasiymN Odour, scent, sweet or disagreeable: see raAYiHapN.
nayosamN i. q. nayosabN.

manosimN The sole (baATin) of the xuf-: or, to a camel, the same as the sunobuk to the horse; (Mṣb;) [i. e., the toe, or nail, or edge of the fore part of the foot, of a camel: see ZufurN:] the extremity of the xuf- of the camel and ostrich and elephant, and of the solid hoof: or each of the two nails (ZuforAani) of the camel, that are upon [each of] his fore-feet: or it is, to a she-camel, like the Zufor to a man: (M:) or the xuf- of the camel, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) and of the ostrich. (Aṣ, Ṣ.)
[Also, † The toe of a human being: see a verse cited voce jacaA, art. jcw.]
1: see 6.
6. tanaAsaAhu He pretended that he had forgotten it: (Ṣ, KL,* TA:) and (TA) he forgot it; (MA, KL,* TA;) like nasiyahu↓: (TA:) [or] he constrained himself to dismiss it from his mind. (MA.)
tunuwsiIa It (a word or the like) was forgotten by degrees. (Occurring often in the larger Lexicons.)

Aln-asaA [vulg. Eiroqu Aln-asaA, app. The sciatic vein;] the portion, in the thigh, of the vein (Eiroq) which, in the back, is called the watiyn, and which extends to the shank, where it is called the SaAfin: (IAth, TA, voce Oaboharu:) or the SAafin and Erq AlnsA are two branches of one Eiroq [or vein]: (Ibn-Seenà, vol. i. book iii. p. 608: [where the opening of each of these to let blood is mentioned:]) [in a solid-hoofed animal,] AlnsA is a vein (Eiroq) proceeding from the hip, or haunch, lying within each thigh, then passing by the hock, so as to reach the hoof: when the breast is fat, each of its thighs becomes cleft by two large portions of flesh, and the nsA runs between them, and is apparent. (Ṣ.) [In the present day it seems to be applied by some to the sciatic nerve: and Eiroqu Aln-asaA, as also AlnasaA alone, often signifies sciatica, or hip-gout: see niqorisN and also XanijN.]
munosiyhaA for manosiYihaA: see a verse cited voce EuqobapN.

1. naXafa AlmaMCa, aor. _i {yanoXifu}, (Mgh, Mṣb,) inf. n. naXofN, (Mṣb,) He took [or absorbed] the water from the ground, (Mgh, Mṣb,) or from a pool, (Mgh,) with a piece of rag or some other thing (Mgh, Mṣb) of a similar kind. (Mṣb.)
2. naX-afato She (a camel) [yielded frothy milk;] had nuXaAfap. (Ṣ in art. rgw. [See 2 in that art.])
4. OanoXafa AlOaroDa AlmaMCa [It caused the earth to imbibe the water], said of the samuwm. (Ḳ voce OaDoraba.)
minoXafapN (pl. manaAXif) A drying-towel; napkin.
5. tanaX-aqa see 10.
10. AisotanoXaqa Alr-iyHa † [He snuffed the wind]: (TA, art. mxr:) he snuffed, scented, or smelt, the wind; as also tanaX-aqahaA↓. (Mṣb.) See 10 in art. Xm.
nuXaAqapN What is taken [or ladled out], while hot, from a cooking-pot. (TA.)
1. naSaEa He, or it, purified. (L.)
4. OanaSafahu He did justice to him: (MA:) he acted equitably with him: (Mṣb:) he gave him, or obtained for him, his right, or due, from (mino) another: see OaEocara.
UinoSAafN The giving what is right, or due: (M:) or the granting, or rendering, justice. (KL, PṢ.)
OanoSafahu mino ZaAlimihi [He exacted justice for him from his wronger]. (T voce Zal-ama.)
8. AinotaSafa minohu He exacted, or obtained, his right, or due, from him (M, Ḳ) completely, so that each of them became on a par with the other; (Ḳ;) [i. e. with equity].
AinotaSafa It became halved: (Mṣb:) [often said of the daytime (Aln-ahaAru)].
Tubixa EalaI Aln-iSofi, and OuSoliHa ElI AlnSf, It (wine) was boiled until half of it had gone, or evaporated. (TA, voce TaAbap.)
makaAnN naSafN bayona makaAnayoni [A place half-way, midway, or equidistant, between two places]. (Mughnee in art. sawaMCN.)
naSafN A middle-aged woman or man: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) or forty-five years old: or fifty years old. (Ḳ.) Dim. nuSyf.
naSiyfN A woman's muffler: see ximaArN.
nuSayofN, dim. of naSafN: see xalayoqN voce xalaqN.
munaS-afN Expressed juice, (Mgh, Mṣb,) or wine, or beverage, (Ḳ,) cooked until half of it has gone [by evaporation]. (Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
manaASafN Not wholly ripe: [half-ripe:] applied to the date. (TA, voce busorN.)
OanoSAafu All-abini [Half-bricks, or] cut bricks, whereof the one is placed, in building, beside the whole brick, for the purpose of ornamentation. (Mṣb in art. xrj.)
naSolN The iron head or blade (Mgh, Ḳ) of an arrow, (Ṣ, Mgh, Ḳ,) and of a spear, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) and of a sword, (Ṣ, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ,) and of a knife, (Ṣ, Mṣb,) and the like. (Mṣb.)
naSolN The spun thread of the spindle: (Ḳ:) see surosuwrN.
liHoyapN naASilN A very white beard. (See AlEanoqaACu Almugoribu, in art. grb.)
maA balilotu mino fulAanK biOafowaqa naASilK: see bal-a and Oafowaqa in two places.
taSomapN or naSamapN An idol: see SanamN.
5. tanaS-aI baniI fulAanK: see tacar-aI.
naSiI-N A certain plant: (Ṣ, TA:) Golius says, a species of thistle; but this seems to be inconsistent with the description of it: see ray-ijapN.
xaSiI-N naSiy-N Gelded, castrated. The second word is an imitative sequent.

naASiyapN properly, in the language of the [classical] Arabs, The place where the hair grows in the fore part of the head: and hence, the hair of that part; the hair over the forehead; (Az, TA;) [and this is the general meaning;] i. q. quS-apN and Tur-apN. (Mṣb, art. qS.) The forelock of a horse.
naASiyapu baniI fulAanK: see tacar-aI and cirowapN.
nuDaArN A tree of which yellow cups (OaqodaAH) are made. (T, in TA, voce garabN.) See warosiI-N.
1. naDalahu He overcame him, or surpassed him, in shooting. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
3. naADalahu He vied, competed, or contended for superiority, with him in shooting. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
naADalahu, inf. n. tinoSaAlN: see bay-anaha.

naADal Eanohu ‡ He defended him, pleaded in defence of him, or repelled from him; (Ḳ, TA;) spoke in his defence, excusing him; (Ṣ, TA;) defended him,, &c., as above; (Ṣ;) contended, or pleaded, in his defence; (TA;) defended him; and contended in his defence. (Mṣb.)
1. naDaA Alxayola He outstripped the other horses: see tajar-ada.
niDowN A lean, or emaciated, camel: fem. with p {niDowapN}. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.) niSowu safarK [Lean, or emaciated by journeying]; applied to a beast. (TA, in rjE.)

5. tanaT-aEa, (KL,) or tnT-E fiI AlkalAami, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) He went deeply, or far, in speech; (KL;) syn. taEam-aqa: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) was exorbitant, or extravagant, therein: (Ḳ:) or tnT-E signifies he spoke with the extremity of his fauces; [or with a guttural voice;] from Aln-iToEu signifying the upper gAr in the mouth. (IAth.)
AlHuruwfu Aln-iTaEiy-apu and AlniToEiy-apu Dental letters: see t.
naToEN see niTaEN.
niToEN see niTaEN.
naTaEN see niTaEN.

niTaEN and niToEN↓ and naTaEN and naToEN A certain thing (Munjid of Kr, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ) that is spread [upon the ground to serve as a table for food, and for play at chess or the like, and to receive the head of a person when it is cut off], (Munjid, Ḳ,) made of leather; (Munjid, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ;) a piece of leather that is spread upon the ground for any of the purposes above mentioned.
The anterior part of the palate; see gAr.
naT-aAEN A man who makes nuTuwE: and who binds books. (T, in TA, art. HT.)
naTafN Earrings: see a verse cited in art. sjd.
nuTofapN Sperma of a man (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ) and of a woman. (Mṣb.)
naATifN A kind of sweetmeat; (Mṣb;) i. q. qub-ayoTaI. (Ṣ, Mṣb.)
1. naTaqa trans. by means of b: see Ḥam, p. 75.
naTaqa bihi means he pronounced it, or articulated it.
naTaqa, said of a bird or any animal: see Bḍ, xxvii. 16.
3. naATaqahN, inf. n. munaATaqapN, He talked, or discoursed, with him; syn. kaAlamahu, (TA,) followed by bi before the subject of talk, &c. (TA in art. frg.)
6. tanaATaqaA They two talked, or discoursed, each with the other; like taqAawalaA. (TA.)
10. AisotanoTaqahu He desired him to speak; (TA;) [interrogated him:] he spoke to him until, or so that, he spoke. (Mṣb.)
niTaAqN The bar (mtrs) of a door. (TA, art. lz.)
niTAaqu AljawozaMCi The Belt of Orion: see AljawozaMCu.
niTaAqapN A ticket of price, or weight: see biTaAqapN.
naATiqN an epithet applied to A deenár.
jacorN naATiqN A rational root, in arithmetic; opposed to jacorN OaSam-u. (Mgh, art. jcr.)
manoTiqN Speech: (Ṣ:) Diction; or expression of ideas, or meanings, by voice and words. (Ḳ, TA.)

minoTaqapN I. q. HiyaASapN; (Mṣb;) A kind of girdle, zone, or waist-belt, which is fastened round the waist with a buckle or clasp; worn by men and by women; and when worn by wealthy women generally adorned with jewels, &c., and having also two plates of silver or gold, also generally jewelled, which clasp together. See UiboziymN.
minoTiyqN Eloquent: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) or able in speech; an able speaker. (TA in art. fwh.)
AlHikomapu AlmanoTuwqu bihaA: see HikomapN.
nayoTalN: see sayoTalN.
naTomapN: see naTobapN.
8. AinotaTati AlmafaAzahu: see AntATt, in art. nwT.
niTaMCN Distance, or far extent; syn. buEodN. (TA.) See gaAYilN, in art. gwl.
naATiyapN A female weaver: pl. nawaATK. (TA in art. crE.)
10. AisonanoZafa Alc-akara mina Albawoli: see AstnqI.
1. naZama [He pierced:] he pierced and knotted a cord or rope: and he (a xaw-aAS) pierced and plaited [the leaves of] the muqol. (M.)
naZama He strung beads. (Mṣb.)
8. AinotaZamahu He transfixed, or transpierced, him; (M;) i. q. Aixotal-ahu. (Ṣ, M, Ḳ.)
AinotaZama It (an affair [and language, &c.]) was or became, rightly [or regularly] ordered, arranged, or disposed. (Mṣb.)
naZomN What are strung, of pearls and beads, &c. (M.)
Aln-aZomu: see AljawozaMCu.
niZaAmN [A standard of a thing, by which to regulate or adjust it. See voce EiyAarN.]
‡ The cause, or means, of the subsistence, of anything; or its foundation, or support; syn. milaAkN: (M, Ḳ:*) a tropical meaning. (TA)
† A way, course, mode, or manner, of acting or conduct or the like: custom, or habit. (M, Ḳ.)

layosa liOamorihi niZAamN † His affair has not a right tendency. (T.) And layosa liOamorihimo niZaAmN † Their affair has not a right way, or method, of procedure, nor connexion, or coherence, (mutaEal-aq,) (M, TA,) nor right tendency. (TA.) And maA zaAla EalaI niZaAmK waAHidK † He ceased not to follow one custom, or manner of conduct. (M, TA.) And OaHaAdiyvu lAa niZaAma lahaA † [Stories having no foundation, or no right tendency or tenour]. (M and Ḳ in art. sTr.)
naZ-aAmN and niZ-iymN↓ A composer of many verses, or of much poetry. (TA.)
niZ-iymN: see naZ-aAmN.

1. naEaZa, aor. _a {yanoEaZu}, inf. n. naEoZN and nuEuwZN (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ,) and naEaZN, (ISd, Ḳ,) It (the zub-, Ṣ, or cakar, Mṣb, Ḳ,) became erect, (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ), by reason of carnal appetite; (Mṣb;) as also AnEZ↓. (M, TA.)

hom.sense: 4. AnEZ, (Mṣb, Ḳ,) inf. n. UinoEaAZN, (Ṣ, Mṣb,) He (a man, Mṣb, Ḳ,) became affected with carnal appetite: (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ:) and in like manner AnEZt, said of a woman. (Mṣb, Ḳ.*)
His penis became extended. (M, in art. rwl.)
AnEZt She (a beast) opened and contracted, alternately, her vulva; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) and so AntEZt↓. (AO, Ḳ.)
See also 1.
AnEZhu He caused it to become erect: (Ṣ:) or put it in motion: (Mṣb:) namely his zub-, (Ṣ,) or cakar. (Mṣb.)

entry.sense: 8. UinotaEaZa see 4.
HirN naEiZN A vulva excited by carnal appetite. (Ḳ.)
naAEuwZN That excites erection of the penis. (Ḳ.) Xrb Aln-aAEuwZi [app. a mistranscription for Xarobapu AlnAEwZ] Medicine which has that effect: mentioned by Z and Ibn-ʼAbbád. (TA.)
1. naEaqa bihimo UilaI AlfitonapK He hallooed them on to fight, etc.: see 10 in art. Ew.
naAEiqN One who drives away the beasts, and cries out after them. (TA in art. zEq.)
naAEiqaMCu: see EaAniqaMCu.
1. naEVla see 4.
2. naE-ala see 4.
4. OanoEalotu Alxuf-a and naE-alotuhu↓ I affixed a sole to the bottom of the xaf- [i. e. boot]: and hence, OanoEalotu Ald-aAb-aha and naEalotuhaA↓. (Mṣb.) See SiromN.
8. AinotaEalato ZilAalahaA: see Zil-N.

naEolN [A sandal: a sole:] the thing by which the foot is preserved, or protected, from the ground; (Ḳ;) syn. HicaMCN: and also applied to a taAsuwmap [or shoe]. (Mṣb.) What is now called taAsuwmap. (IAth, TA.) It often signifies only a sole: so in the Ṣ, Ḳ, Mṣb, &c., in art. xSf, &c.

The leathern shoe, or sandal, of a camel; which is attached by thongs, or straps, called saraAYiH ( pl. of sariyHapN) to the xadamap or plaited thong which surrounds the pastern: see sariyHapN and xadanapN.
naEolN of a sword The iron, (Kr, Ṣ, Ḳ,) or silver, (Ṣ,) thing [or shoe] at the lower end of the scabbard. (Kr, Ṣ, Ḳ.) See gaAXiyapN, and 2 in art. frS.
naEolN meaning A Har-ap, or hard rugged tract of land,, &c.: see raHolN.
naEolN ‡ A wife. See Eatabap.
niEaAliy-N One who takes care of the sandals or shoes [at the door of a bath or mosque]. (TA in art. vwb.)
naAEilN Wearing, or having on the feet, sandals.
1. naEima EayoXuhu His life was, or became, plentiful and easy: (Mṣb:) was, or became, good, or pleasant. (Mgh.) See EawofN.
naEima, aor. _u {yanoEumu}, is like faDila, aor. _u {yanoEumu}, and HaDira, aor. _u {yanoEumu}. See the latter.
AinoEimo DabaAHFA, and Eimo SabAHFA: see tariba and SabaAHN.
naEuma, inf. n. nuEuwmapN; (Ṣ, Mṣb;) and naEima; (Ṣ;) It was, or became, soft, or tender, (Ṣ, Mṣb,) to the feet. (Mṣb.)

2. naE-amahu, (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ,) and naAEamahu↓, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) He (God, Ṣ, Mṣb,) made him to enjoy, or lead, a plentiful, and a pleasant or an easy, and a soft, or delicate, state, or life; a state, or life, of ease and plenty. (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ.)
naE-amahu He nourished well him, or it; pampered him.
3. naAoEama see 2.
4. OanoEama Ealayohi biXaIoCK He conferred, or bestowed, upon him a thing as a favour. See OaHosana.
OanoEama Eajonahu He kneaded it well, thoroughly, or soundly. (TA, voce rayoEN.)
OanoEama Ald-aq-a He bruised or powdered finely: see daq-aqa.
OanoEama Taboxahu He cooked it well; syn. OajaAda Taboxahu. (IbrD.) The verb is often used in this sense.
OanoEama Qll-ehu bika EayonFA: see OabogaDa.
5. tanaE-ama he enjoyed, or led, an easy, a pleasant, a soft, or a delicate, life, with ampleness of the means of subsistence; a life of ease and plenty. (Ḳ.)
tanaE-ama It (a tree) became flourishing and fresh, (TḲ, art. rwI, &c.,) luxuriant, succulent, sappy, soft, tender, and supple. See rawiIa.
tanaE-ama i. q. tamat-aEa. (Mṣb.*)
nuEomN contr. of buWosN, (Ṣ,) [like naEomaMCu↓ and nuEomaI↓ and naEomapN↓ and naEiymN↓:] pl. OanoEumN. (Ṣ.) See niEomapN.
naEamo Even so; yes; yea. (Mṣb, &c.) See Oajalo and bajalo.

naEamN Pasturing maAl [or cattle]; mostly applied to camels, and neat, and sheep and goats: or applied to all these, and to camels when alone, but neat and sheep or goats when alone are not thus termed; (Mṣb;) therefore, cattle, consisting of camels or neat or sheep or goats, or all these, or camels alone.
niEoma Alr-ajulu zayodN Excellent, or most excellent, or excellent above all, is the man, Zeyd; or [very or] superlatively good,, &c. (Mṣb.)
See bYosa.
naEomapN subst. of tanaE-umN (Mṣb, Ḳ) in the sense of taraf-upN subst. of tamat-uEo (Mṣb:) or i. q.
tanaE-umN: (Ṣ: in F's smaller copy, tanaEiymN, an evident mistake:) i. e. plentifulness, and pleasantness or easiness, and softness or delicacy, of life: ease and plenty.

naEomapN A living in [or rather enjoyment of a life of] softness, daintiness, or delicacy, and ease, comfort, or affluence: (KL:) i. q. naEiymN↓; (Mṣb;) and mutoEapN: (Jel in xliv. 26:) it is from Alt-anaE-umu; and niEomapN↓ is from AlUinoEaAmu. (Ksh, cited in Kull, p. 364.) See niEomapN: and see turofapN.
naEomapu AlX-abAabi [The flourishing freshness, softness, tenderness, or blooming loveliness or graces, of youth. See EaboEabN.]
naEomapN Softness; tenderness; bloom; or flourishing freshness (IbrD;) of a branch; and of youth, or youthfulness. (M, art. mld;, &c.)

niEomapN and nuEomaI↓ and naEomaMCu↓ A benefit; benefaction; favour; boon; or good: (Ṣ, Mṣb:) a blessing; [bounty; gratuity;] or what God bestows upon one: and so naEiymN↓: (Ṣ:) [grace of God:] and naEiymN↓ and naEomapN↓, with fet-ḥ, [and nuEomaI↓ and naEomaMCu↓ and nuEomN↓, ease and plenty,] enjoyment; (Mṣb;) [welfare; well being; weal:] nuEomaI↓ and naEomaMCu↓ are the contr. of buWosaI and baOosaMCu: (TA, art. bOs:) naEomaMCu↓ baEoda Dar-aMCa, in the Ḳur [xi. 13,] is like health after sickness; and richness, or competence, after want. (Bḍ.)
niEomapN A blessing; (Ṣ;) a cause of happiness. (Ḳ.) A favour: a benefit; and the like. (Ṣ.)
niEomapN Wealth, or property. (Ḳ.) The first explanations given to it above are assigned in the Ḳ, not to this word, but to naEiymN↓ and nuEomaI↓.
niEomapN with the article seems generally to signify Wealth: and without the article, A benefit, benefaction, favour, boon, or blessing.
nuEomapN The act of rejoicing by a thing: and the state of rejoicing in a thing. (KL.)
nuEomaI contr. of buWosaI; (Ṣ, TA in art. bOs;) and naEomaMCu contr. of baOasaMCu. (TA in that art.)
See niEomapN.
naEomaMCu: see niEomapN.
naEiymN Enjoyment; [delight; pleasure;] as also naEomapN↓, q. v.: (Mṣb:) plenty and ease. (Ḳ.) See niEomapN.
naEaAmapN The blackness of night. (Ṣ in art. sqT.) see an ex. voce sqoTN.
naEaAmapN The ostrich: it sometimes denotes the female. See maxozuwmN and jarAadN.
XAalato naEaAmatuhumo: see TaAYirN, zaOolN, XaAla, and a verse voce Uim-aA.

Aibonu Aln-aEaAmapi The shank-bone: and a certain vein in the leg: and the middle, or beaten track, of the road: and the brisk, lively, or sprightly, horse: and the drawer of water (Als-aAniI) who is at the head of the well. (T in art. bnI.)
naEaAmapN and naEaAmataAni of a well see zuronuwqN.

Aln-aEaAYimu Nine stars [of Sagittarius], behind AlX-awolapu, four in the Milky Way, [β, γ, δ, and ε,] called AlnEAYmu AlwaAridapu, as though drinking; and four without the Milky Way, [ζ, σ, τ, φ,] called AlnEAYmu AlS-aAdirapu, as though returning from drinking; and the ninth, [λ,] [not mentioned by some,] high between them: each of the two fours forming the corners of a quadrilateral figure. The twentieth Mansion of the Moon. (El-Ḳazweenee.)
EayoXN naAEimN [A plentiful and easy life. See naEima EayoXuhu.] A pleasant life. (Mgh.) [A soft, or delicate, life.]
naAEimN Soft, or tender: applied to a plant or tree: (Mgh:) [smooth; sleek. And i. q. mutan-iEamN.]
munaE-alN, applied to a horse, white on the forelegs: see Oaqofazu.
OanaAEiymu, pl. pl. of naEamN: see a verse cited voce daAnaI.
1. naEaAhu He announced his death: see a verse cited voce TuwbaAlapN.
nugonugapN: see gunodubap, and lugodN.
Aln-agaAniEu Certain portions of flesh by the uvula. (O in art. Elq.)
nagafaAtN Portions of dry mucus: see saliylapN.
nugaAqN and nuEaAqN, of a crow, signify the same. (Lḥ in O, art. Ewq.)
nagilN [in the CK nagolN] A hide vitiated, or rendered unsound, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) in the tanning. (Ḳ.)
Uibonu nagiylapK The son of a female slave. (T in art. bnI.)

1. nagama, aor. _i {yanogimu} and _a {yanogamu}, He spoke in a low, gentle, or soft, voice or tone: (Ṣ, Mṣb:) [he spoke in an undertone:] he used such a voice in singing: (Ḳ:) or he modulated his voice, or made melody, in singing. (TḲ.) See jrs.
2. tanogiymN: see XiynN.
5. tanag-ama: see jarasa.
nagomapN Gentle-toned speech; syn. jarosu AlkalAami: (Mṣb:) and sweetness of voice, or melody, in recitation [and in singing]. (Ṣ, Mṣb.)
[Also, A musical sound, or note:] a melody: see TaroqN: sweet sound: pl. nagamaAtN. (KL.)
munaAgamapN: see voce baAgamahu.

3. naAgaAhu He interchanged speech with him, each of them addressing the other with a word or saying: (TA:) nagayotu Uilayohi nagoyapN signifies I addressed to him a word or saying: and AlmunaAgaApu signifies AlmuwaAjahapu. (JK.)
1. nafaEahu It profited him; availed him; was of use or benefit, or was useful or beneficial, to him.
nafaEahu minohu: see an ex. voce jad-N.
yanofaEu likacaA, and mino kacaA, It (a medicine) is good, beneficial, or profitable, as a remedy, for, or against, such a thing, meaning such a disease or the like.
2. naf-aEahu, inf. n. tanofiyEN, He caused nafoE to come to him. (TA.)
8. AinotafaEa bihi He benefited or profited by it; made use of it; had the use of it; enjoyed it; like tamat-aEa bihi. See 10.
10. AisotanofaEahu He sought, or demanded, his profiting him, or being useful to him. (IAạr, TA.)
And AisotanafaEa sometimes occurs in the sense of AinotafaEa↓. (TA.)
nafoEN contr. of Dar-N: (TA:) or a thing whereof one makes use for the attainment of good: (B:) or good: or a means of attaining one's desire. (Mṣb.)
manofaEapN [A cause, or means, of advantage, profit, utility; or benefit: and simply, advantage; profit, or profitableness; utility, use, usefulness; or benefit:] contr. of maDar-apN. (Ṣ, art. Dr.)
1. nafaqati Als-uwqu The marked became brisk, its goods selling much; syn. qaAmat. (Ḳ.)
nafaqa It was, or became, saleable; easy, or ready, of sale; or in much demand: see its syn. raAja.
nafaqato It (a commodity, siloEap,) was in much demand: and she (a woman) was demanded in marriage by many. (Mṣb.)
nafiqati Ald-arAahimu, inf. n. nafaqN, The dirhems passed away, came to an end, or became spent or exhausted; syn. nafidat. (Mṣb.)

3. naAfaqa He played the hypocrite in religion: (Ḳ, TA:) he pretended, to the Muslims, that he held the religion of El-Islám, concealing in his heart another religion than El-Islám. (Mṣb.) And naAfaqa fulAanFA He acted with such a one hypocritically. (TḲ in art. dhn. [But I have not found this elsewhere.]) And naAfaqa fiI AlmaHab-api [He acted the hypocrite in respect of love]. (Ḥar, p. 505.) See xaAna.
4. Oanofaqa He expended money: and he (God or a man) dispensed gifts.
5. tanaf-afati Aljazuwru [The slaughtered camel became dealt out, or dispensed]. (Ṣ, Ḳ in art. XyT.)
tanaf-aqa: see Ḥar, p. 472.
tanaf-aqa It (a wound) cracked in its sides, and made, in the flesh, what resembled OanofaAq↓, i. e. holes in the ground, or subterranean excavations or habitations, pl. of nafaqN. (TA in art. dsm.)

hom.sense: nafaqN: see sarabN
OanofaAqN The hole of rats or mice. (Ṣ, TA in art. xfI:) see 1 in that art.: holes in the ground; or subterranean excavations or habitations; pl. of nafaqN. (TA in art. dsm.) See 5.
Also Fresh olive-oil: see faAqN in art. fwq: also mentioned in art. nfq in the TA.

entry.sense: nafaqapN What one expends, of money and the like, (Ḳ, TA,) upon himself and upon his family or household. (TA.)
nayofaqN The part of a pair of drawers, or trousers, which is turned down at the top, and sewed, and through which the waistband, or string, passes. See nuqobap.
2. naf-alahu, inf. n. tanofiylN, He gave him spoil, (Ṣ, Mṣb,* Ḳ,) and a free and disinterested gift. (Mṣb, Ḳ.) And it is doubly trans.: see 2 in art. gnm.
nafalN Trifolium melilatus indica of Linn.: and medicago intertexta of Linn. (Delile, nos. 706, 730.)
nafalN: see ganiyamapN.
nufalN: see tusaEN.
naAfilapN: the pl. nawaAfilu, is explained in the TA, art. Hrz, by zawaAYidu [Accessions, or additions].

What accedes to, or exceeds, the original. (T.) A voluntary gift, by way of alms, or as a good work: (T:) a gift: (Ḳ:) or a gift Eano yadK: (M:) a deed beyond what is incumbent, or obligatory. (M, Ḳ.)
naAfilapN Supererogatory prayer. (Ṣ, Mṣb.) See taTaw-aEa.
1. nafaAhu He drove away, expelled, or banished, him, or it. (T, in TT.)
3. hecaA yunaAfiIhecaA This precludes the co-existence of this therewith; is inconsistent, or incompatible, with this.
6. tanaAfayaA They two were incompatible.
8. AinotafaI It was negative: contr. of vabata and and wajaba. (IbrD.)
AinotafaI mino XaIoCK He denied a thing; meaning an accusation or the like: syn. tanaD-aHa.

nufaAyapN Refuse; i. e. what one rejects, of a thing, because of its badness: (Ṣ:) or refuse little in quantity: (T:) or the remains, and bad portion, of a thing: (M, Ḳ:) or, accord. to IAạr, what is bad of wheat or food. (M.)
fiEolN manofiI-N A verb rendered negative by its being preceded by maA or the like; contr. of muvobatN and muwjabN.
kalAamN manofiI-N A denied sentence; contr. of muvobatN and muwjabN; virtually the same as kalAamN naAfK a denying, or negative, sentence.

1. naqaEa and AisotanoqaEa↓ It (water) remained, or stagnated, or collected, in a hollow, or cavity: (Mgh:) or remained long, and became altered: (Mṣb:) or the former [and latter] collected in a manoqaE: (Ṣ:) or the latter [and former] became yellow and altered. (Ḳ.)
naqaEa and OanoqaEa↓ [He macerated, steeped, or soaked, a medicine, in water,] he left it in water until its colour became changed. (Mṣb.)
4. OanoqaEa see 1.
10. UisotanoqaEa see 1.
naqiyEN An infusion; meaning, a beverage made by steeping something in water: (Mṣb:) and a mash.
sam-N naAqiEN Poison that takes effect; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) that kills: (TA:) that remains fixed, (Abu-nNasr, Ḳ, TA,) and collects. (Abu-Naṣr, TA.)
OanoqaEu More, or most, thirst-quenching: see an ex. under AlHaAcu, in art. Hwc; and another voce raXafa.
OanoquwEapN The hollow, or depression, of variyd, (Ṣ, A, Ḳ,) in which the gravy collects. (A, Ḳ.*)
manoqaEu maMCi, and masotanoqaEu↓ maMCK, A place where water remains and collects; where it collects and stagnates; or where it remains long, and becomes altered. See naqaEa.

manoqaEu Alburomi Untwisted old thread which a woman spins a second time, and puts into the stone cooking-pots, because she has nothing but these [in which to deposit it]. (Ṣgh, Ḳ, TA. [From the Ḳ it would seem to be munoqEN alone: and in the CK, AlburAm is erroneously put for AlbirAm: Golius found it written AlbaraAm; and has wrongly explained it in his Appendix.])
sam-N munoqaEN Poison made into a confection. (Ṣ, Ḳ, TA.)
masotanoqaEN: see manoqaEN.
mnoqaAfN A species of wadaE [or cowry]; (Ṣ, Ḳ *;) pl. manaAqifu; (TA in art. wdE: and thus in the M in art. dml: in the T in that art. manaAqiyf: see damaAlN.) See buwqN.
1. naqalahu He related it, told it, or mentioned it, from another; he transmitted it; he transcribed it. See 1 in art. HkI. naqala Uilayohi HadiyvFA [He related to him a tradition]. (Mṣb.)

naqalahu He transferred it; shifted it; translated it; conveyed it. He discerned it, or took and mentioned it, namely a word or phrase or signification, from (mn) such a one; he quoted it; i. e. naqalahu UilaI kitaAbihi mino kitaAbK Mxara he transferred it to his book from another book.
5. tanaq-ala biAln-uqoli [and tnq-l alone] He ate nuqol. (MA.)
Hence, tanaq-ala biAlHadiyvi He amused himself with talk; like as one amuses himself with the eating of fruit after a meal: see tafak-aha.
8. Ainotaqala He shifted, removed, or passed, from one place, or time (as in an instance in the Ḳ voce OasowaEa), or state, to another.

sense.hi: The shifting of the feet from place to place.

entry.sense: baMCu Aln-afoli i. q. baMCu Alt-aEodiyapi The b that renders a verb trans.; as in cahaba bihi. (Mughnee in art. bi.)

Alt-aMCu liln-aqoli or AlhaMCu liln-aqoli means liln-aqoli mina AlwaSofiy-api UilaI AlAisomiy-api, i. e. The p that is added for the transference of a word from the category of epithets to that of substantives; as in xaliyfapN, accord. to some, and daAYirapN.

nuqolN Dried and other fruits (such as nuts, almonds, raisins, dried figs, dried dates,, &c.), [and comfits:] the fruit [that is an accompaniment] of wine; (MA in explanation of nuqolN [which is more common than naqolN];) fruit that is eaten with wine. (KL in explanation of nuqolN.)
naqalN Stones with trees. (AZ and IḲṭṭ in TA, voce gadarN.)
manoqalapN i. q. maroHalapN (JK, Mṣb) mino marAaHili Als-afari. (JK.)
minoqalapN A thing upon which bricks are carried from place to place. (O, voce XabaHapN.)
munaq-ilapN: A wound in the head, by which bone is removed: see Xaj-apN.

Almanoquwlu [Discerned knowledge; opposed to maEoquwlu]: under this term are comprised the sciences of OuSuwlu Ald-iyni (also called Eilomu AlkAm). AlHadiyvu, and Alfiqohu: all the other sciences are comprised under the term AlmaEoquwlu; (IbrD;) i. e. intellectual, or perceived by the intellect; and excogitated.
OanoqaliysN [An eel] i. q. [Pers.] maAro maAhiI [and Oanokaliyso]. (En-Naḍr, in TA, voce jir-iyvN.)
1. naqama Ealayohi He exacted vengeance upon him, punished him: see an ex. voce AbdI in art. bdw. See 8.

8. Ainotaqamotu minohu I took, or executed, vengeance on him, or inflicted penal retribution on him, for that which he had done: (JK:) or I punished him; (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ;) as also naqamotu↓ minohu, (Mṣb, Ḳ,) and Ealayhi, (TA,) aor. _i {yanoqimu}; (Mṣb, Ḳ;) and naqimotu. (Ḳ.)
See niqomapN.
niqomapN [and AinotiqaAmN↓] Vengeance; or penal retribution. (JK.)

1. naqaha He recovered, but not completely, his health and strength: (TA:) or he became convalescent; or sound, or healthy; at the close of his disease: (Ṣ:) or sound, or healthy, but was yet weak. (Ḳ.) See bariYa.
naqAahapN [Convalescence;] the slight degree of health that immediately succeeds sickness. (TA, art. brO.)
2. naq-aAhu He cleansed it; cleared it; picked it; purified it; removing from it what was bad. (Mṣb, &c.)

10. AisotanoqaI He took extraordinary pains, or the utmost pains, in cleansing his body. (Mgh.) You say also, AisotanoqaI Alc-akara mina Albawoli (Ḳ, art. brO,) [He took extraordinary pains in cleansing the cakar from urine: or] he cleansed the ckr entirely from urine; syn. AisotanoZafahu. (TA in that art.)
AisotinoqaACN: see voce AisotaboraOa.
niqoIN The pith of canes, or reeds: see cihonN.
Somewhat of fat in a camel. (TA in art. TEm.)
And Marrow; i. q. mux-N. (TA voce SuhaArapN.)

banaAtu Aln-aqaI, or Aln-aqaA, The Hulakap [or Hulokap]; to which the fingers (banaAn) of virgins are likened: (T in art. bnI:) a certain small reptile, that dwells in sand, resembling a fish, smooth, and having a mixture of whiteness and redness; called also XaHomapu Aln-aqaA. (TA.) See HulakapN and XaHomN.
naqFA or naqFI An extended gibbous piece of sand. (Ṣ,* Mṣb,* Ḳ.)
nuqaAyapN The extract, or refuse, of a thing: see EuSaArapN.
munoqK, said of a sheep, Becoming a little fat: see saAH-N.
A sieve, syn. girobaAlN. (TA, art. dws.)
munaq-iyapN A woman who trims the split palmstalks in mat-making: see XaTaba and XaATibapN.
4. Oanokaza: see munokidN and cam-apN.
manokizN: see munokidN.
nikoEapN, so written for nakaEapN or nukaEapN in the O and Ḳ, voce suwqapN, q. v., [The head of a plant.]
1. nakifa minaAlX-aIoCi, aor. _a {yanokafu},; inf. n. nakafN; and nakafa, aor. _u {yanokufu}; and Astnkf↓; He abstained from, or refused to do, the thing, from disdain and pride. (Mṣb.)
5. tanak-afa bimawoDiEi kacaA [He waited,, &c.,] i. q. talay-ava. (TA in art. Sqr, from the “Nawádir.”)
10. Aisotanokafa minohu (KL,* MA) He disdained, or scorned, it; was ashamed of it. (KL, MA.) See 1.
nakafapN: see gunodubapN, and lugodN.
1. nakila, aor. yanokulu, see 1 in art. fDl.
Aln-ikolu signifies Oal-aciI yunokilu OaqoraAnahu. (A, art. ED.)
See nakalN.
nakalN and nikolN↓: see badalN.
nakaAlN Any punishment serving to give warning to others than the sufferer: (M, Ḳ, TA:) or that restrains the offender from repeating the offence. (Bḍ, ii. 6.)
nakohapN The odour of the mouth. (Ṣ, TA.)
1. nakiIa, aor. _a {yanokaIu}, inf. n. nakaMCN, He (an enemy) was defeated, and overcome. (TA, art. nkO.)

nikaAyapN The inflicting injury upon an enemy: (MA, KL:) slaying and wounding among the enemy: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) or making much slaughter, (MA,) or a great, or vehement, slaughter or wounding, (Mṣb,) [i. e. the making havock,] among the enemy: (MA, Mṣb:) the inflicting a routing and overthrow among the enemy. (ISk, TA.)
niylajN and niylanojN Indigo-pigment: see nuwuwrN, in art. nwr.
nulokN A kind of medlar-tree, Mespilus aronia. See ruwbapN.

1. nam-a He [uttered calumny: or] excited discord, or dissension, and made known discourse in a mischievous manner; or embellished speech with falsehood. (M, Ḳ.) You say, nam-a bihi and Ealayohi, inf. n. nam-N and namiymapN and namiymN, or this last is pl. of namiymapN, (M,) meaning, He calumniated him; or misrepresented him.
nam-a AlHadiyva He made known, divulged, or told, conversation, in a malicious or mischievous manner, so as to occasion discord, dissension, or the like. (TA, art. qt; and Mṣb.*)
R. Q. 1. namonama He variegated a thing: he decorated or embellished it. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
namiymapN The sound of the bow-string. (Kr.)
namiymapN Malicious and mischievous misrepresentation; calumny; slander; (Ṣ, Ḳ;) the embel-lishment of speech with falsehood. (Kr.)
nam-aAmN now commonly applied to Wild thyme, thymus serpyllum: see XabahaAnN.
naAm-apN The artery in the head: see Oaboharu.
munamonamN A garment, or piece of cloth, figured with marks resembling writing, or otherwise. See macab-arN.
OanomaSu Having no eyebrows. (TA in art. vT.)
nam-aAgapN The upper part of the head: and also the part that is in a state of commotion, of the yaOofuwx of a child, before it becomes hard. (L, TA.) See also yaOofuwxN.
2. nam-ala Alv-awoba [He mended a garment] i. q. rafaOahu. (TA in art. lqT.)
5. tanam-ulN A formication or stinging, as of the torpedo fish: see “Abdollatiphi Hist. Aeg. Comp.,” p. 82.
namolu sulayomaAna Red ants: see OaHowaI, in art. Hw.

OanomalapN (thus generally written, Mṣb) The head [or end] of a finger; (Ṣ, Mṣb;) i. e. (Mṣb) the joint (mafoSil) (Az, Mṣb) in which is the nail: (Az, Mṣb, Ḳ:) [i. e. the ungual phalanx, with, or without, the flesh upon it: (see qaSabN:)] or a joint, or an articulation, (Euqodap) of the fingers. (Mṣb.)

1. namaI, aor. _i {yanomiIu}, inf. n. namaMCN, It increased; (M, Ḳ, Mgh, TA;) multiplied; became plentiful, or abundant; (Mṣb, TA;) said of a thing, (Mṣb,) of cattle, or wealth, (Ṣ, Mgh, TA,), &c. (TA.)
namati AlOaroDu The land throve, or yielded increase.
4. OanomaI AlS-ayoda The quarry died out of sight of the sportsman: see OaSomaI.
8. AinotamaI Uilayohi He asserted his [own] relationship [of son] to him; (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ;) like AiEotazaI. (Ṣ and Mṣb in art. Ezw.)

naAmiyapN, of a grape-vine, The shoot upon which are the bunches of grapes: (M, Ḳ:) or the eye, or bud, that breaks open so as to disclose its leaves and its berries: (M:) or its branches: pl. nawaAmK. (T.)
R. Q. 1. nahonaha bihi He cried out to him, or at him, namely, a beast of prey, in order that he might forbear, refrain, or abstain. (TA.)
Aln-awaAhiqu The channels of the tears of a horse. (M in art. sm.)
1. nahika AlX-arAaba He consumed the beverage. (Ḳ.)
nahikahu Ald-ibAagu [The tan wore it, or eroded it], namely, a hide. (M and Ḳ, voce mufalofalN.) See mafalofalN.
8. Ainotahaka maHaArima Qll-ehi [He violated the sacred ordinances of God;] he did that which God had forbidden him to do. (Ḥar, p. 18; where see more.)
Ainotahaka Huromatahu He violated [his honour, &c.]. (MA.)
manohuwkN Affected with a constant, or chronic, pervading disease; or emaciated by disease, so as to be at the point of death. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
See mavoluwvN.
nahalN A fir t drinking: see EalalN.
manohalN A watering-place; i. e., a spring to which camels come to water. (Ṣ, Mṣb.)
1. nahima He had an inordinate desire or appetite (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ) for food. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
nahiymN A chiding of camels. (TA.)
TariyqN nah-aAmN A road wherein is [heard] a chiding of camels: (TA:) see Han-aAnN.
1. nahaAhu Eanohu He forbade him it.
laAtusohaI walaA tunohaI: see art. shI, in two places.
6. tanaAohaIa see 8.
8. AinotahaI Eanohu, and tanaAhaI↓, He refrained, abstained, or desisted, from it, as forbidden; left, relinquished, or forsook it. (Ṣ, Mṣb.) See an ex. of the latter voce sawaAdN.
AinotahaI Uilayohi It ultimately reached, or extended, and sometimes it so pertained, to him, or it: in the latter sense said of authority and the like: and simply, it reached to him, or it.
AinotahaI Uilayohi Alxabaru, and tanaAhaI↓, The information, or news, reached him. (Ṣ.)
AinotahaI UilaI mawoDiEK He came at last, or ultimately, to a place. So I have rendered it in explaining OafoDaI.
AinotahaI It (a thing, or an affair,) attained the utmost possible point, or degree. (Mṣb.) It (fruit, and the like) attained its utmost state of growth.
AinotahaI It is ended: a word put to mark the end of a quotation.
rakiba Aln-ahoIa He did that which he was forbidden to do. (TA in art. rdE.)
nahuw-N is anomalous, (TA,) like baguw-N.
nihaAyapN The utmost possible point, or degree: (Mṣb:) and the ultimate point, or element, to which a thing can be reduced or resolved: its utmost point or particular: as also manotahFI↓. See faS-N.
nihaAyapN fiI Als-axaMCi [Extreme in bounty, or munificence]. (O and Ḳ, voce masoHalN.)
naAhiyka biOaxiynaA [A person sufficing thee is our brother]: the b is added to denote emphatic praise. (Fr in TA, art. bi.) See also Ḥar, p. 28, and, more particularly, p. 91.

munotahFI A place to which a person or thing comes at last; a journey's end; a goal; a destination, or place or state to which a person or thing is appointed to come; an end; an ultimate object: see an ex. in a verse near the end of art. b. See nihaAyapN.
sidorapu AlmunotahaI (Ḳur liii. 14) The lote-tree of the ultimate point of access, in the Seventh Heaven: see sdr.
AlguraAbu Aln-uwHiI-u [The Noachian crow;] an appel-lation applied in Egypt to the zAg (or rook). (TA, art. zyg.)
Aln-awoTapu The crop of a bird: see Aljir-iyoYapu.
nw-ATp The same as nuw-aAEapN. See ruj-aAHapN.
5. tanaw-aEa, said of a branch of a tree: see tanaw-asa.
tanaw-aEa It became of various sorts, or species. (Mṣb.)
nuw-aAEapN A child's swing, of rope. See ruj-aAHapN.
muniyfN High; lofty; applied to a mountain, and a building. (T.) You say also Eiz-N muniyfN [High nobility]. (Ḳ in art. EyT.)
2. naw-aqa [He broke, or trained, a camel]. (TA, voce muSoEabN.)
5. tan-ayaqa fiI maToEamihi wamalobasihi, and nanaw-aqa, He was nice and luxurious (tajaw-ada wabaAlaga) in his diet and his apparel. (JK, Ḳ.) Better explained voce taOan-aqa.
tanaw-aqa: see taOan-aqa and tajaw-ada, and niyqapN.
niyqN quasi-inf. n. of OanaAqa.
naAqapN: see qaluwSN, and baEiyrN, and bakorN.
naAqapu AlHac-aMCi: see riHaAlapN.
OayonuqaAtN pl. of OayonuqN pl. of naAqapN: see a verse cited voce musohamN.

niyqapN a subst. from taw-aqa (IJ, Ṣ, Ḳ) as syn. with taOan-aqa (Ṣ) [and therefore signifying Daintiness, nicety, exquisiteness, refinement, or scrupulous nicety and exactness; and the exceeding of what is usual in a thing: or the choosing what is excellent, or best, to be done, and doing admirably: or the doing firmly, solidly, soundly, or thoroughly, and skilfully: or] the exceeding what is usual in a thing, and making it good, or beautiful, and firm, solid, sound, or free from defect or imperfection. (Ḥam, p. 625) See taOan-aqa.
1. naAla, aor. yanaAlu, has for inf. ns. naAlN and manaAlN and manaAlapN. (TA.)
See 6.
3. naAwalahu XayoYFA He gave him a thing; presented, or offered, it to him; gave him it with his hand; handed it to him; syn. EaATaAhu; (T;) he gave him a thing with his extended hand. (T, Ḳ.)
5. tanaw-ala EalyonaA biXaIoCK yasiyrK: see taTaw-ala.
6. tanaAwala maMCa AlHawoDi [He reached, and drank of, the water of the drinking-trough]: said of a camel. (Ṣ, art. nwX.)
tanaAwala mino yadihi XayoYFA He took from his hand a thing; took it with his hand from his (another's) hand; syn. taEaATaAhu. (T.)

[tanaAwala XayoYFA He reached a thing; took it with his hand; handed it to himself;] he took a thing with the extended hand; (TḲ;) or simply he took a thing; took it with his hand, took hold of it; syn. Oaxacahu: (Ḳ:) best rendered, he took, or reached, or reached and took, a thing, absolutely, or with the hand, or with the extended hand; and in like manner, with the mouth, as in an instance voce ram-a, &c.; he helped himself to it (i. e. food).
tanaAwalahu biAls-ayofi He reached, or hit him, with the sword: see nafaHahu: and see taXaAwaluwA, and OaTaf-a.
huwa qariybu AlmutanaAwali and saholu AlmatanaAwali [app. He is one from whom it is easy to take, or receive, gifts,, &c.]. (TA.)
tanaAwaluwA Alr-imaAHa: see 6 in art. cwq.
tanaAwalahu bimaA yasuwWuhu [He carped at him by saying, or taxed or charged him with, that which would grieve him].
tnAwlh bmA layosa fiyhi [He carped at him by saying, or taxed or charged him with, what was not in him]. (TA, voce AigotaAbahu.)
tanaAwalahu bilisaAnihi He carped at him with his tongue: (IbrD:) as also naAlahu↓. (TA, art. hlb.)
tnAwl XayoYFA It (a noun, &c.) applied to a thing.
tanaAwala It comprehended, or comprised: post-classical in this sense, but commonly used. (MF, TA.)
tanaAwalahu bimaA yukurahu He taxed or charged him with, or accused him of a thing disliked, or hated. See also art. nyl; see an explanation of AigotaAbahu, and see ZahorN.
naAlN: see nawaAlN.
nawaAlN and naAYilN↓ (Ṣ, Ḳ) and naAlN↓ (Ḳ) A gift: (Ṣ, Ḳ:) and a benefit, or favour, obtained from a man. (TA.) See two exs. of the first voce xiroqN: and an ex. of the second voce EarabapN.
nawaAlN is also used as an inf. n. See an ex., from El-Aạshà, voce layosa.
naAYilN: see nawaAlN.
minowaAlN The web-beam of a loom; the beam on which the web is rolled, (Ṣ, Mṣb, in art. nwl, and Ṣ, Ḳ, voce Haf-apN,) as it is woven. (Mṣb.)
1. naAmato rijoluhu † I. q. xadirato [His leg, or foot, became benumbed, or torpid]. (TA in art. bsr.)
naAma † It (a woman's anklet) ceased to sound, by reason of the fulness of the leg: like as one says [in the contr. case], AstyqZ. (TA in art. yqZ.)
naAma has for its inf. ns. nawomN and manaAmN. (Mṣb.)
naAma Alv-awobu i. q. raqada [q. v.] (A, art. rqd.)
naAmati Als-uwqu i. q. raqadat [q. v.] (Th, in TA, art. rqd.)
naAma ‡ He lay; as opposed to he sat and he stood. See naAYimN.
naAma Eano HaAjatihi He cared not for the object of his want, neglected it. (Mṣb.)
2. naw-ama and OanaAma↓ † It benumbed, or torpified: see naAmato rijoluhu.
3. naAwamotuhu fiI XiEaArK waAHidK [I slept with him in one under-garment]. (Ṣ, art. XEr.)
4. OanoAama see 2.
10. AisotanaAma Uilyohi He trusted to him, and became quiet, or easy, in mind; relied upon him. (Ṣ, Ḳ.)
AimoraOapN naWuwmu AlD-uHaI i. q. raquwdu AlDHI [which see]. (A, art. rqd.)
naAYimN ‡ Lying; as opposed to sitting and standing. (Mgh.)
Oanowamu [More, or most, prone to sleep]. (A, art. fhd.)
manaAmN Time of sleep. (Jel, xxxix. 43.) See also 1.
nawonapN The dimple in the chin of a young child: (M, Ḳ:) see xunoEubapN, and qalotapN, and daAYirapN, and 2 in art. dsm.

1. naAha bihi (Mṣb) and naw-aha↓ bihi (Ṣ, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ) He rendered famous (Ṣ, Mgh, Mṣb, Ḳ *) and magnified; (Mṣb;) and rendered notorious; (Mgh;) it, (Ṣ, Mṣb,) namely a person's name, (Ṣ,) or a thing, (Mṣb,) or him. (Mgh.)
2. naw-aha see 1.
1. nawaAhu and AinotawaAhu↓ He intended it, purposed it, designed it, aimed at it, proposed it to himself as the object of his aim.
8. AinotawaI Alqawomu manozilFA bimawoDiEi kacaA (Ṣ, Mṣb) The people, or party, repaired, or betook themselves, to, or towards, a place of alighting or abode, in such a place. (Mṣb.) See 1.
AinotawaI It (a people, or company of men,) removed from country to country, or town to town. (TA.)
nawFI Date-stones: they are often used as food for camels; (see UibilN nawawiy-apN;) and for this purpose are bruised, and sometimes mixed with barley, and then moistened: see basiysapN.

nawaApN What is cut off in the circumcision of a girl. (Lḥ, in TA, voce EucorapN.) The name shows that this is the prepuce of the clitoris, the end of which resembles the end of a date-stone. But see baZorN.

Aln-awaI What remains of the place of circumcision of a girl after that operation; i. e. the baZor: (M:) or the place of circumcision of a girl, which is what remains of her baZor when the mutok has been cut off. (T.)
nawFI Pieces of gold, each of the weight of five dirhems. (TA in art. jb.)

nawFI The tract, or region towards which one goes (Ṣ) in journeying, whether near or distant; (Ṣ;) the place that is the object of a journey: (El-Ḳálee, TA:) [a traveller's destination:] the course, or direction, that one pursues (Ḳ, TA) in journeying and in acting or conduct: (TA:) see an ex. voce SarofN (third sentence), and Eaqara. It is of the fem. gender. (Ṣ.) See an ex. in some verses cited voce bayonN.
niI-N and naI-N: see art. nyO.

niy-apN An intention, an intent, a purpose, a design, an aim; a determination of the mind, or heart: (Mṣb, TA:) this is the general meaning: (Mṣb:) the direction that one takes (Ṣ, Mṣb, Ḳ) in a journey, (Ṣ, Ḳ,) near or distant, (Ṣ,) and in an action: (Ḳ:) the thing that one intends, or purposes, or aims at: an affair: (Mṣb:) the place to which one purposes journeying: (Ṣ in art. zl:) see an ex. from a rájiz in art. zl, first paragraph: the thing, or place, that one proposes to himself as the object of his aim, in an action, or a journey: or the thing, or place, that is the object of an action or journey: see Tiy-apN and Xul-apN.
niy-apN naqaHN i. q. TaraHN and DrHN, &c. (O, art. DrH.)

niy-apN baEiydapN: see baEydN, where the p of the latter word has been accidentally omitted. It also often (or generally) means A distant, or remote, thing, or place, that is the object of an action or journey:, &c.
OanaA munotawK Eano hacaA AlOamori I. q. mataray-iEN, q. v. (TA in art. ryE.)
1. naAka AlmaTaru AlOaroDa, and Aln-uEaAsu Eayonahu: see nakaHa.
1. naAla minohu He defamed him. (L, art. qbH.)
naAla mino EiroDihi He defamed him. (T, Ḳ, TA.)
naAl minohu He harmed, hurt, or injured him, namely, an enemy. (Mgh.)
naAlahu bilisaAnihi is coupled in the Mṣb, art. qrS, with OacaAhu; and seems plainly to signify OaSAabahu, which, in this case, is the same as OacaAhu. And tanaAwalahu↓ has a similar meaning.
naAla He obtained, or attained. (Ṣ, Ḳ.) naAla mino Eaduw-ihi He attained [or obtained] the object of his aim, or desire, from his enemy. (Mṣb.)
naAlahu, aor. yanaAlu, It reached him; came to him; syn. waSala Uilayohi. (M, art. nyl.) See also Bḍ, xxii. 38.
naAlahu, first. pers. nilotahu, inf. n. nayolN, He obtained it; he attained it; namely, the object of his wish, &c. (Ṣ, Ḳ, Mṣb, &c.)
4: see 1.
6. humaA yatanaAyalaAni and yatanaAwalAani signify the same. (TA.)
nayolN Obtainment;, &c.: see 1.
UinaAnapN The act of giving: (PṢ in art. nyl;) the giving a gift. (KL.) It seems properly to belong to art. nwl.
nayolN (T, M, Ḳ) and naAYilN↓ (M, Ḳ) What one obtains, or acquires, (T, M, Ḳ,) of the bounty of another; like nawaAla. (T.)
